td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Tuesday 14
Cloudy agreeable weather, a severe frost last night whic[h] freezes bay entirely over, men at the road Jonas & Lamo[tte] at the top mast – Jacob still laid up with a his foot.
Wednesday 15
This has been an uncommon fine day, equal to one in May for mildness, men employed as usual in the woods Jonas & Lamotte at a main yard – Jacob making sinnet – freezes intensely last eve[.]
Thursday 16
Cloudy mild weather, measured the Portage whic[h] is exactly ½ a mile[.] Men employed at their usual work[.]
Friday 17
Dull cloud mild weather threatening rain & [snow] men employed as usual – very little frosts during the nights.
Saturday 18
Cloudy & cold NW wind, but no frost, the Ice in the bay again breaks up[.] Jonas & Lamotte employed at some saw logs for the Nancy[.]
Sunday 19
Cloudy & very cold weather – throughout the night blows a violent gale from the NW – accompanied with snow[.]
Monday 20
Tempestuous weather blowing strong & drifting much, men go to the woods, but, return from the badness of the weather afternoon set them to drawing yarns, making helves ax &c[.]
Tuesday 21
The weather still continues boisterous, men are continued at their usual work the bay last night closes again[.]
Wednesday 22
The weather with undiminished severity continues go on board the Nancy on the Ice men at their usual occupations drawing yarns making oakum &c Jacob & others kill a Cow[.]
Thursday 23

Fore part of this day blows strong from the NW, with snow which is now about a foot deep – men go to Mr Ermatingly to assist in getting the roof on his mill, Jonas & another go to the woods and are their employed sawing plank for the Nancy – myself laid up with a swelled eye – last part of this day a violent storm, with heavy drift which continues until 9 PM the weather then becomes more moderate & freezes very intens[ely.]
Friday 24
Jonas finished sawing – now at some oak for partners to the fore mast, the others at the road – agreeable weather, clear & very cold, light winds from the Westward[.]
Saturday 25
The weather this day is uncommonly moderate, & little wind from the Northward – gave men 3 qts rum & Mr Logans ½ gallon – 28lb flour & 4 Ps beef to the Seam[en.]
Sunday 26
The wind this day is from the SE & blows very strong the weather not cold, but inclined to thaw, at 8 PM the wind encreases to a hurricane strong gale[.]
